article.title: February 2016 Release Notes Updates
article.summary:
GSA has made recent updates to eOffer. Find out the details of the update and how they impact you today.

Read More
article.body:
On February 13, 2016, GSA implemented changes to the Solicitation Clauses section of the eOffer System. The following changes will be made:

  • In order to capture the most detailed information about your offer, the Basic Information template now lists each clause separately by its number and title. You will now be required to complete several screens, as opposed to just one. Depending on the type of clause, the data you enter into each field will be different.

Be sure to check the updated version of Responding to Solicitation Clauses in the Preparing Your Electronic Contract Offer (eOffer) Guide, under eOffer Resources.

article.title: November 2015 Release Notes Updates
article.summary:
GSA has made recent updates to eOffer/eMod. Find out the details of the update and how they impact you today.

Read More
article.body:
In November 2015, GSA implemented changes to the eOffer/eMod System. The follow changes have been made:

  • In support of category management, all professional services schedules have been consolidated under one schedule called the Professional Services Schedule.

    You can learn more about the Professional Services Schedule (PSS) on the Professional Service Category Community on Interact or the PSS portal page, Professional Service Schedule.

  • The Help Links throughout ORS have been updated to send users to this guide on the AM Systems Support site. The Help On This Page video links have also been removed as the videos will be migrated and maintained on the ORS Guide within the AM Systems Support site.

The next release is in February of 2016. Check back to find out the latest updates.

article.title: May 2015 Release Notes Updates
article.summary:
GSA has made recent updates to eOffer/eMod. Find out the details of the update and how they impact you today.

Read More
article.body:
In May 2015, GSA implemented changes to the eOffer/eMod System. The follow changes have been made:

  • Price reduction modifications are now effective immediately upon submission. This affects the following modifications:

    • Temporary Price Reduction
    • Permanent Price Reduction (based on Most Favored Customer)
    • Permanent Price Reduction (Industry Partner Request)

  • Vendors may now respond to Solicitation Provisions in formatted text entry fields. Read about Responding to Solicitation Provisions here.

article.summary:

Read More
article.body:
In November 2014, GSA implemented changes to the eOffer/eMod System. The follow changes have been made:

  • Vendors have been given the ability to express their Commercial Sales Practice (CSP) in terms of Markup/Build Out to better capture their business model.

  • When a vendor wishes to create a new offer based off a withdrawn or rejected offer, the system gives vendors the ability to import information from the previous eOffer. This feature now includes Commercial Sales Practice (CSP) data. Read about Commercial Sales Practices here.

article.title: September 2014 Release Notes Updates
article.summary:
In September 2014, GSA implemented changes to the eOffer/eMod System.

Read More
article.body:
In September 2014, GSA implemented changes to the eOffer/eMod System. The follow changes have been made:

  • When a Vendor submits a new Offer under the CORP Schedule, eOffer will now ask if the vendor is migrating existing contract(s) to a consolidated contract under the Standard Responses section.

  • On the eOffer/eMod Homepage, there is now a list in the About eOffer section titled View Solicitations that contains links to MAS Schedule Solicitations, (previously found in the Learn More About: section), and Non-MAS Schedule Solicitations.

    MAS and Non-MAS Schedules can now be found on the eOffer/eMod homepage

article.title: May 2014 Release Notes Updates
article.summary:
In May 2014, GSA implemented changes to the eOffer/eMod System.

Read More
article.body:
In May 2014, GSA implemented changes to the eOffer/eMod System. You can read a detailed description of each update on the Release Notes website.

  • In situations where you would have needed to exercise a Novation Agreement Modification, a Name Change Modification, or an Address Change Modification, you may have also needed to update your DUNS number. Previously, you would have needed to reach out to your Contracting Officer, whereas now eMod gives you the option to modify your DUNS within the system.

    Learn more by clicking on the links for each respective Modification:

    • Novation Agreement Modification
    • Name Change Modification
    • Address Change Modification

article.title: February 2014 Release Notes Updates
article.summary:
In February 2014, GSA implemented changes to the eOffer/eMod System.

Read More
article.body:
In February 2014, GSA implemented changes to the eOffer/eMod System. You can read a detailed description of each update on the Release Notes website.

  • eOffer/eMod is now compatible with Firefox to support a wider ranger of users.

  • The Add Labor Category and/or Service Offering now requires Vendors to go through the Subcontracting Plan utility to add a Subcontracting Plan to their Contract. Previously, users simply uploaded a handmade Subcontracting Plan.

    To learn more, read the Subcontracting Plan section under the eMod Resources category of the User Guide.

  • Vendors can now choose two full years for their Subcontracting Plan on Commercial Plans, whereas previously the utility only allowed Vendors to choose a one year term.

    To learn more, read the Subcontracting Plan section under the eMod Resources category of the User Guide.
